Entries.default: "What say, you need something?" An unassuming aumaua turns to you with a smile.
[Study him carefully.]
He possesses the warm tones of an island aumaua, calm eyes, and a minute scar on his upper lip. Your close scrutiny unnerves him, and he takes a cautious step back.
"That's close enough." He scratches his ear, glancing to the left and right.
You almost missed it, but you spot a smudge of ink on his right thumb and index finger. As he brings down his hand, he unconsciously pats a bulge in his pocket.
Nodding to you, Maia makes it clear that she noticed it as well.
"What are you doing?"
"I am getting some air." He gestures to the surrounding port with both hands, smiling all the while.
"Likely story." Maia folds her arms and studies him.
"Do we have a problem, friend?" He glances from Maia back to you.
"If you're the walking corpse who's following Tuaha, then we have a big problem."
"Enjoying a drink. Such things are still allowed in Port Maje." He makes a toasting gesture and winks at you.
"Couldn't help but notice the ink on your fingers."
"Ah, this? I have been working late practicing my calligraphy." He mimics holding a quill.
"I don't have time for these games. Be well." He begins to leave with a sense of purpose, frowning to himself.
"Stay away from Tuaha before I have to get personally involved."
Nothing about him physically changes, but his bearing shifts from ease to something altogether more rigid as he stares you down.
"You must have me mistaken for someone else. This is not a name which I know." He shrugs.
"Maia, take aim at his knee. Shoot to wound."
"With pleasure." She cocks back the hammer of her gun and aims down, closing one eye.
He takes a shaky step back, regarding Maia with wide-eyed bewilderment.
"Of course it is. You have orders to follow her every move."
"My friend Maia here doesn't make mistakes. Do you?"
"I've got a good eye, and right now it's showing me a liar who plays at being as dumb and guileless as the rest of his tribe." She crosses her arms and waits.
[Attack] "You must have mistaken me for someone who values your life."
"Listen to me. You're being followed."
He pales, glancing left and right with alarm.
"No one told me to expect you. There are proper channels to discuss this!" His whisper lowers to an urgent hiss.
[Lie] "Because they could not trust your discretion, brother. You've been exposed."
"You messed up, and now the professionals need to take charge." Maia hides a small smile.
He nods, closing his eyes and letting out a heavy sigh.
"I... withdraw myself from the mission. Our cause is too important to chance on my... incompetence. I will deliver my report and accept disgrace."
"Give me your report on Tuaha. I will pass it on with a glowing recommendation."
"You would do that?" He stands straighter, his chest swelling with a hopeful breath.
"If Tuaha is a trading company agent, she has not been activated yet. I found no evidence in her quarters, so I wished to shadow her until her contact revealed themselves."
"That's all I know. Whatever Rauatai has planned, she might only be a part of it." He shakes his head, frowning.
"Good. Now leave this island and never return."
"As you say." He nods, taking a last look at Port Maje before turning his attention to the closest available ship.
"Hey. Just kidding."
[Attack] "You are beyond redemption. Seek your atonement in the Beyond."
[Lie] "I was the one who argued to spare your life. Don't make me change my mind."
"Or go ahead and give us an excuse." Maia raises her brow and gives him room to speak.
He raises a trembling hand to his mouth and shakes his head.
"You need to work on the cloak and dagger routine some more."
His lips press together and his hand strays toward his weapon.
"Who are you? Do not waste your lies." His eyes move up and down over your body in a calculating manner.
"The one who's going to beat your face in if you don't leave Tuaha alone."
Something about your presence causes him to take a step back, alarmed.
"I was never here. Tuaha is not a name I have heard before." He turns on his heel and walks briskly away, snapping his head around to make sure he isn't followed.
"Maia, care to take this?"
"Who we are isn't important. You're spying on my friend, and that stops now." Maia raises herself up to her full height as she addresses him.
Something in Maia's tone hits him, and he regards her under a brow furrowed with deep disapproval.
"Huana who conspire against their people... they are a blight on our future. You are more cancerous than any trading company." He looks Maia up and down, shaking his head.
"Tell us who sent you, or I'll have the hide scoured from your back!" Maia grimaces, drawing her breath in a low hiss.

"You are all coldness and hunger. The teachings of your tribe, the tradition... none of it lives on in you." 

He begins to draw his weapon, his expression a mask of sorrow.
"She's trying to save your life, which is more than you're doing."
He stills the movement of his hand, eyeing both you and Maia with deliberate slowness and consideration.
"If I turn and go, you will not shoot me in the back?" His brow crinkles with a meager hint of worry and self-preservation.
"Get out of here. You never saw anything - not Tuaha, and not us."
[Attack] "Good point. I'd rather shoot you in the face."
[Say nothing.]
"Ekera... as much guarantee as I will get in these friendless days." Exhaling sharply, he turns and walks away from you, his every step uncertain.
"Wait, why are you doing this?"
"Rauatai knows of no future where we are left in peace. If you give comfort to traitors and spies, I cannot let you leave." He nods, resolved.
[Attack] "If that's the way you want it."
With a cry of battle on his lips, he lunges after you both.
"All that matters is that your mission is over."
"And you have this one chance to decide if you want your 'retirement' to be boring or interesting. I vote interesting." Maia raises her brow and waits.
[Attack] "I am the last person you will see in this life."
[Attack] "Filthy spy."
He takes stock of the pallor of your skin, pursing his lips doubtfully.
[Attack] "Oh no, looks like someone's about to have an accident."
[Let him go.]
Blinking in surprise, he draws his weapon and readies himself to parry your attack.
"Ink and a pocket full of notes... you the one going after Tuaha?"
"How did you know about..." He blinks at you and clears his throat.
"Farewell."
"Oh..." Looking up at you, an unassuming aumaua swallows hard.
"W-what say? You need something?"
"H-hello again." His attempt at a smile falters.
"Again our paths cross. What say?" He looks you up and down.
"No problem. Farewell."
Squinting, he nods and observes your departure closely.

"Sure you have, and I keep Ishiza around for the fun of it."

Hearing his name, the bird perks up before resuming his regular patrol for bugs.
He regards Maia's presence with a mixture of annoyance and curiosity, pressing his lips together.
"How do, friend? You need something?"
"Ekera, what do you need?"
"How do, friend?"
Stepping back and coughing into her fist, Maia pointedly avoids eye contact.
Sniffing, Maia passes you a subtle nod.
"That goes for you or your fetching friend." He smiles at Maia, winking.
"Forgive me, the mistake is mine. Farewell."
"Hmmm."
"What's she thinking?"
"And worse, you would drag Ngati's Chosen down with you." He presses his lips together, regarding Tekēhu with a look of disappointment.
"I am no more a part of this than you, brother!" Tekēhu aims a sour look in Maia's direction.
